docs.title: Integration tests
docs.text: This project includes a set of fast integration tests (marked integration) and some heavy tests (marked slow). The heavy tests are intended to run less frequently (nightly or on-demand) since they generate full projects and may exercise DB setup.

docs.title: Run tests locally
docs.text:
• Fast integration tests (integration but not slow):
pytest -q -m "integration and not slow"
  • All integration tests (including slow):
pytest -q -m integration
  • Only slow tests:
pytest -q -m slow

docs.title: Why slow tests are separate
docs.text: Some tests generate complete projects and simulate DB backends. They are valuable but may be slower and sometimes rely on filesystem timing. We run them nightly or on-demand in CI to keep PR feedback fast while still catching regressions.

docs.title: CI
docs.text: We added a workflow Integration Tests (nightly) that runs all integration tests on a schedule and can be triggered manually. There's also a separate workflow that runs slow tests only.

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text: Get started with Vyte in minutes! This guide will walk you through installing Vyte, creating your first project, and running it.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.11 or higher
  • pip (Python package installer)

docs.title: Install Vyte
docs.text: pip install vyte

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
vyte --version

You should see the version number displayed.

docs.title: Create Your First Project
docs.text: Let's create a simple FastAPI project with SQLAlchemy and PostgreSQL.

docs.title: Interactive Mode (Recommended)
docs.text:
The easiest way to get started is using interactive mode:

vyte create

You'll be prompted for:

  1. Project name - e.g., "my-api"
  2. Framework - Choose FastAPI, Flask-Restx, or Django-Rest
  3. ORM - Choose SQLAlchemy, TortoiseORM, or Peewee
  4. Database - Choose PostgreSQL, MySQL, or SQLite

docs.title: Command-Line Mode
docs.text:
If you prefer, specify all options in one command:

vyte create my-api --framework FastAPI --orm SQLAlchemy --database PostgreSQL

Pro Tip

Use the shorthand flags: -f for framework, -o for ORM, -d for database

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
After creation, you'll have a fully structured project:

my-api/
├── app/
│   ├── __init__.py           # Application factory
│   ├── main.py               # Entry point
│   ├── database.py           # Database configuration
│   ├── api/
│   │   ├── __init__.py
│   │   └── routes/
│   │       ├── __init__.py
│   │       └── users.py      # Example user routes
│   └── models/
│       ├── __init__.py
│       └── user.py           # Example user model
├── alembic/                  # Database migrations
│   ├── versions/
│   └── env.py
├── tests/                    # Test suite
│   ├── __init__.py
│   ├── conftest.py
│   └── test_users.py
├── .env.example              # Environment variables template
├── .gitignore
├── alembic.ini               # Alembic configuration
├── pyproject.toml            # Project dependencies
└── README.md

docs.title: Key Files
docs.text:
• app/main.py - Application entry point
  • app/database.py - Database connection and session management
  • app/models/ - SQLAlchemy/ORM models
  • app/api/routes/ - API endpoints
  • alembic/ - Database migration scripts
  • .env.example - Copy this to .env and configure

docs.title: 1. Set Up Environment Variables
docs.text:
Copy the example environment file:

cd my-api
cp .env.example .env

docs.title: 2. Edit .env
docs.text: Open .env and configure your database:

docs.title: For PostgreSQL (Production)
docs.text: DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:password@localhost:5432/my_database

docs.title: For SQLite (Development)
docs.text: DATABASE_URL=sqlite:///./test.db

docs.title: For MySQL
docs.text:
DATABASE_URL=mysql://user:password@localhost:3306/my_database

Important

Never commit your .env file to version control! It's already in .gitignore.

docs.title: Using pip
docs.text: pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: Using Poetry (if configured)
docs.text: poetry install

docs.title: Run Database Migrations
docs.text:
Before running your application, create the database tables:

# Generate initial migration
alembic revision --autogenerate -m "Initial migration"

# Apply migrations
alembic upgrade head

About Alembic

Alembic is a database migration tool that tracks schema changes and applies them safely.

docs.title: FastAPI Projects
docs.text:
uvicorn app.main:app --reload

The API will be available at:

  • API: http://localhost:8000
  • Interactive Docs: http://localhost:8000/docs
  • Alternative Docs: http://localhost:8000/redoc

docs.title: Flask-Restx Projects
docs.text:
python app/main.py

or

flask run

The API will be available at:

  • API: http://localhost:5000
  • Swagger Docs: http://localhost:5000/api/doc

docs.title: Using FastAPI Interactive Docs
docs.text:
1. Open http://localhost:8000/docs in your browser
  2. Try the example endpoints (e.g., /users)
  3. Click "Try it out" to test requests

docs.title: Using curl
docs.text:
# Create a user
curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/users" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     -d '{"username": "john", "email": "john@example.com"}'

# Get all users
curl http://localhost:8000/users

# Get a specific user
curl http://localhost:8000/users/1

docs.title: Using httpie
docs.text:
# Install httpie
pip install httpie

# Create a user
http POST localhost:8000/users username=john email=john@example.com

# Get all users
http localhost:8000/users

docs.title: Run Tests
docs.text:
Your project comes with a basic test suite:

pytest

For coverage report:

pytest --cov=app tests/

docs.title: What's Next?
docs.text: Now that you have your project running, you can:

docs.title: 1. Add More Models
docs.text:
Edit app/models/ to add your domain models:

# app/models/post.py
from sqlalchemy import Column, Integer, String, ForeignKey, Text
from app.database import Base


class Post(Base):
    __tablename__ = "posts"

    id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, index=True)
    title = Column(String(200), nullable=False)
    content = Column(Text, nullable=False)
    user_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey("users.id"))

docs.title: 2. Add Routes
docs.text:
Create new route files in app/api/routes/:

# app/api/routes/posts.py
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from app.database import get_db

router = APIRouter(prefix="/posts", tags=["posts"])


@router.get("/")
def list_posts(db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    # Your logic here
    pass

docs.title: 3. Customize Configuration
docs.text:
See the Configuration Guide to learn about:

  • Environment variables
  • Database settings
  • Logging configuration
  • Security settings

docs.title: 4. Deploy Your API
docs.text:
Check out deployment guides for:

  • Docker containerization
  • Cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
  • CI/CD pipelines

docs.title: Database Connection Error
docs.text:
Problem: Can't connect to PostgreSQL/MySQL

Solution:

  1. Make sure the database server is running
  2. Check your DATABASE_URL in .env
  3. Verify username/password are correct
  4. Ensure database exists

docs.title: Migration Errors
docs.text:
Problem: Alembic migration fails

Solution:

  1. Check database connection first
  2. Delete alembic/versions/*.py files and regenerate
  3. Reset database: alembic downgrade base then alembic upgrade head

docs.title: Import Errors
docs.text:
Problem: Module not found errors

Solution:

# Make sure you're in the project directory
cd my-api

# Reinstall dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: Port Already in Use
docs.text:
Problem: Address already in use

Solution:

# Use a different port
uvicorn app.main:app --reload --port 8001
